member.name: T:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectCategory
member.summary: An enum which represents the categories of an effect.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectCategory.None
member.summary: Represents an uncategorized effect.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectCategory.Positive
member.summary: Represents an effect with a positive player impact.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectCategory.Negative
member.summary: Represents an effect with a negative player impact.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectCategory.Movement
member.summary: Represents an effect which modifies a player's movement speed.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectCategory.Harmful
member.summary: Represents an effect which deals damage to a player over time.

member.name: T:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType
member.summary: Status effects as enum.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.None
member.summary: This EffectType do not exist it's only use when not found or error.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.AmnesiaItems
member.summary: The player isn't able to open their inventory or reload a weapon.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.AmnesiaVision
member.summary: The player isn't able to see properly.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Asphyxiated
member.summary: Drains the player's stamina and then health.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Bleeding
member.summary: Damages the player over time.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Blinded
member.summary: Blurs the player's screen.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Burned
member.summary: Increases damage the player receives. Does not apply any standalone damage.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Concussed
member.summary: Blurs the player's screen while rotating.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Corroding
member.summary: Effect given to player after being hurt by SCP-106.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Deafened
member.summary: Deafens the player.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Decontaminating
member.summary: Removes 10% of the player's health per second.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Disabled
member.summary: Slows down the player's movement.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Ensnared
member.summary: Prevents the player from moving.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Exhausted
member.summary: Halves the player's maximum stamina and stamina regeneration rate.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Flashed
member.summary: Flashes the player.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Hemorrhage
member.summary: Drains the player's health while sprinting.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Invigorated
member.summary: Reduces the player's FOV, gives infinite stamina and gives the effect of underwater sound.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.BodyshotReduction
member.summary: Reduces damage taken by body shots.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Poisoned
member.summary: Damages the player every 5 seconds, starting low and increasing over time.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Scp207
member.summary: Increases the speed of the player while also draining health.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Invisible
member.summary: Makes the player invisible.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.SinkHole
member.summary: Slows down the player's movement with the SCP-106 sinkhole effect.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.DamageReduction
member.summary: Reduces overall damage taken.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.MovementBoost
member.summary: Increases movement speed.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.RainbowTaste
member.summary: Reduces the severity of negative effects.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.SeveredHands
member.summary: Drops the player's current item, disables interaction with objects, and deals damage while effect is active.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Stained
member.summary: Prevents the player from sprinting and reduces movement speed by 20%.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Vitality
member.summary: Causes the player to become gain immunity to certain negative status effects.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Hypothermia
member.summary: Cause the player to slowly take damage, reduces bullet accuracy, and increases item pickup time.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Scp1853
member.summary: Increases the player's motor function, causing the player to reduce the weapon draw time, reload spead, item pickup speed, and medical item usage.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.CardiacArrest
member.summary: Effect given to player after being hurt by SCP-049.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.InsufficientLighting
member.summary: Cause the lighting in the facility to dim heavily for the player.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.SoundtrackMute
member.summary: Disable ambient sound.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.SpawnProtected
member.summary: Protects players from enemy damage if the config is enabled.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Traumatized
member.summary: Make Scp106 able to see you when he is in the ground (stalking), causes the player's screens to become monochromatic when seeing Scp106, and instantly killed if attacked by Scp106.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.AntiScp207
member.summary: It slows down the player, providing a passive health regeneration and saving the player from death once.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Scanned
member.summary: The effect that SCP-079 gives the scanned player with the Breach Scanner.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.PocketCorroding
member.summary: Teleports the player to the pocket dimension and drains health until the player escapes or is killed. The amount of damage recieved increases the longer the effect is applied.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.SilentWalk
member.summary: Reduces walking sound by 10%.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Marshmallow
member.summary: Makes you a marshmallow guy.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Strangled
member.summary: The effect that is given to the player when getting attacked by SCP-3114's Strangle ability.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.EffectType.Ghostly
member.summary: Makes the player nearly invisible, and allows them to pass through doors.

member.summary: Heavy Containment Zone Nuke elevator.

member.summary: Heavy Containment Zone SCP-049 elevator.

member.name: F:Exiled.API.Enums.ElevatorType.LczB

member.summary:
This attribute is used within Harmony patches and the relative annotations to define a target element.
A target element can be a , or .
allows to define elements made for patching.
A target-patching approach is useful to patch specific elements without having to directly patch everything without considering excluded elements.
Target-patching also allows to emit patches without having to manually define and/or supply parameters and elements made for patching

member.name: M:Exiled.API.Features.Core.StaticActor.NotifyInstanceRepeated

If a duplicated instance of a component is loaded into the scene this method will be called instead of .
That way you can customize what to do with repeated instances.
member.remarks: The default approach is delete the duplicated component.

member.name: M:Exiled.API.Features.Items.Item.Create(ItemType,Exiled.API.Features.Player)
member.summary:
Creates a new with the proper inherited subclass.
Based on the , the returned can be casted into a subclass to gain more control over the object.
- Usable items (Adrenaline, Medkit, Painkillers, SCP-207, SCP-268, and SCP-500) should be casted to the class.
- All valid ammo should be casted to the class.
- All valid firearms (not including the Micro HID) should be casted to the class.
- All valid keycards should be casted to the class.
- All valid armor should be casted to the class.
- Explosive grenades and SCP-018 should be casted to the class.
- Flash grenades should be casted to the class.
The following have their own respective classes:
- Flashlights can be casted to .
- Radios can be casted to .
- The Micro HID can be casted to .
- SCP-244 A and B variants can be casted to .
- SCP-330 can be casted to .
- SCP-2176 can be casted to the class.
- SCP-1576 can be casted to the class.
- Jailbird can be casted to the class.
Items that are not listed above do not have a subclass, and can only use the base class.
member.param: The of the item to create.
The who owns the item by default.
member.returns: The created. This can be cast as a subclass.

member.name: M:Exiled.API.Features.Pickups.Pickup.Create(ItemType)
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new with the proper inherited subclass.
Based on the , the returned can be cast into a subclass to gain more control over the object.
- All valid ammo should be cast to the class.
- All valid firearms (not including the Micro HID) should be cast to the class.
- All valid keycards should be cast to the class.
- All valid armor should be cast to the class.
- All grenades and throwables (not including SCP-018 and SCP-2176) should be cast to the class.
The following have their own respective classes:
- Radios can be cast to .
- The Micro HID can be cast to .
- SCP-244 A and B variants can be cast to .
- SCP-330 can be cast to .
- SCP-018 can be cast to .
- SCP-2176 can be cast to .
Items that are not listed above do not have a subclass, and can only use the base class.
member.returns: The created .

member.name: P:Exiled.API.Features.Player.SessionVariables
member.summary:
Gets the dictionary of the player's session variables.
Session variables can be used to save temporary data on players. Data is stored in a . The key of the data is always a , whereas the value can be any . The data stored in a player's session variables can be accessed by different assemblies; it is recommended to uniquely identify stored data so that it does not conflict with other plugins that may also be using the same name. Data saved with session variables is not being saved on player disconnect. If the data must be saved after the player's disconnects, a database must be used instead.

member.name: P:Exiled.API.Features.Player.Role
member.summary:
Gets a that is unique to this player and this class. This allows modification of various aspects related to the role solely.
The type of the Role is different based on the of the player, and casting should be used to modify the role.
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
= .
If not listed above, the type of Role will be .
If the role object is stored, it may become invalid if the player changes roles. Thus, the property can be checked. If this property is , the role should be discarded and this property should be used again to get the new Role. This role is automatically cached until it changes, and it is recommended to use this property directly rather than storing the property yourself.
Roles and RoleTypeIds can be compared directly. Player.Role == RoleTypeId.Scp079 is valid and will return if the player is SCP-079. To set the player's role, see .

member.name: M:Exiled.API.Features.Round.Restart(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ServerStatic.NextRoundAction)
member.summary: Restarts the round with custom settings.
member.param: Indicates whether or not it'll be a fast restart. If it's a fast restart, then players won't be reconnected from the server; otherwise, they will.
Overrides a value of . Makes sense if someone used a command to set another action.

The .
- does nothing, just restarts the round silently. - restarts the server, reconnects all players. - shutdowns the server, also disconnects all players.

member.returns: A describing whether or not the round was successfully ended.

member.name: P:Exiled.API.Features.Server.SessionVariables
member.summary:
Gets the dictionary of the server's session variables.
Session variables can be used to save temporary data. Data is stored in a . The key of the data is always a , whereas the value can be any . The data stored in a session variable can be accessed by different assemblies; it is recommended to uniquely identify stored data so that it does not conflict with other plugins that may also be using the same name. Data saved with session variables is not being saved on server restart. If the data must be saved after a restart, a database must be used instead.
